## ErrorMap type

 Standardized Firebase Error.

Usage:

// Typescript string literals for type-safe codes type Err = 'unknown' \| 'object-not-found' ;

// Closure enum for type-safe error codes // at-enum {<!-- -->string<!-- -->} var Err = { UNKNOWN: 'unknown', OBJECT\_NOT\_FOUND: 'object-not-found', }

let errors: Map<!-- -->&lt;<!-- -->Err, string<!-- -->&gt; = { 'generic-error': "Unknown error", 'file-not-found': "Could not find file: {<!-- -->$file<!-- -->}<!-- -->", }<!-- -->;

// Type-safe function - must pass a valid error code as param. let error = new ErrorFactory<Err>('service', 'Service', errors);

... throw error.create(Err.GENERIC); ... throw error.create(Err.FILE\_NOT\_FOUND, {<!-- -->'file': fileName<!-- -->}<!-- -->); ... // Service: Could not file file: foo.txt (service/file-not-found).

catch (e) { assert(e.message === "Could not find file: foo.txt."); if (e.code === 'service/file-not-found') { console.log("Could not read file: " + e\['file'\]); } }

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare type ErrorMap<ErrorCode extends string> = {
    readonly [K in ErrorCode]: string;
};
```
